rice.name: Rice
rice.description: Rice is the seed of the grass species Oryza sativa or less commonly Oryza glaberrima.

maize.name: Maize
maize.description: Maize, also known as corn, is a cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico.

chickpea.name: Chickpea
chickpea.description: Chickpea is a legume of the family Fabaceae, subfamily Faboideae.

kidneybeans.name: Kidney Beans
kidneybeans.description: Kidney beans are a variety of the common bean (Phaseolus vulgaris).

pigeonpeas.name: Pigeon Peas
pigeonpeas.description: Pigeon pea is a perennial legume from the family Fabaceae.

mothbeans.name: Moth Beans
mothbeans.description: Moth bean is a drought-resistant legume grown mainly in arid and semi-arid regions.

mungbean.name: Mung Bean
mungbean.description: Mung bean is a plant species in the legume family.

blackgram.name: Black Gram
blackgram.description: Black gram is a bean grown in South Asia.
blackgram.regions: Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh

lentil.name: Lentil
lentil.description: Lentil is an edible legume. It is known for its lens-shaped seeds.

pomegranate.name: Pomegranate
pomegranate.description: Pomegranate is a fruit-bearing deciduous shrub in the family Lythraceae.

banana.name: Banana
banana.description: Banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

mango.name: Mango
mango.description: Mango is a juicy stone fruit produced from numerous species of tropical trees belonging to the flowering plant genus Mangifera.

grapes.name: Grapes
grapes.description: Grapes are a fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis.

watermelon.name: Watermelon
watermelon.description: Watermelon is a plant species in the family Cucurbitaceae, a vine-like flowering plant originally domesticated in Africa.

muskmelon.name: Muskmelon
muskmelon.description: Muskmelon is a species of melon that has been developed into many cultivated varieties.

apple.name: Apple
apple.description: Apple is a deciduous tree, generally standing 6 to 15 ft (1.8 to 4.6 m) tall in cultivation and up to 30 ft (9.1 m) in the wild.

orange.name: Orange
orange.description: Orange is the fruit of various citrus species in the family Rutaceae.

papaya.name: Papaya
papaya.description: Papaya is a tropical fruit tree, native to the tropics of the Americas.

coconut.name: Coconut
coconut.description: Coconut is the fruit of the coconut palm (Cocos nucifera), a tree of the palm family.

cotton.name: Cotton
cotton.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll, or protective case, around the seeds of the cotton plants.

jute.name: Jute
jute.description: Jute is a long, soft, shiny vegetable fiber that can be spun into coarse, strong threads.

coffee.name: Coffee
coffee.description: Coffee is a brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans, the seeds of berries from certain Coffea species.
